results.title: Glove puppetry - Scenery and production
results.brief_description: Final film in the series devoted to “Creative Leisure’. The children see the culmination of their work then they assemble scenery and puppets for the staging of their play. The children paint the backdrop and throne; gather leaves and stalks for scenery; and make baskets, fishing line, and table as props before staging their puppet play “Snow White and Rose Red.”

results.title: Glove puppetry - Painting and dressing
results.brief_description: Children paint and dress their own puppets at the Brisbane Creative Leisure Centre. The puppets being to come to life as colourful expressions are painted on, wigs added, and a strip of glue felted around the neck. Using a paper pattern, clothes are cut out, and then sewn strongly together.

results.title: Glove puppetry - making the heads
results.brief_description: Children make their own puppets to illustrate a story. After watching a play at the Brisbane Creative Leisure Centre children learn how to mould puppet heads onto cardboard rolls with paper pulp. They use paper strips to add features, and finally leave them to dry on strands also made at the centre.

results.title: Gloucester Cathedral
results.brief_description: A study of Gloucester Cathedral; within the building are great circular columns of Norman architecture; vaulting of the nave and choir is rich in style; painted glass windows date from the 14th century; detailed studies of the cloisters and the fan tracery.
results.description: A study of Gloucester Cathedral; within the building are great circular columns of Norman architecture; vaulting of the nave and choir is rich in style; painted glass windows date from the 14th century; detailed studies of the cloisters and the fan tracery.

results.title: A Glittering song
results.creator_credit: Praha Loutkovy Film and Short Film Studio
results.brief_description: An animated children’s film in which bits of coloured glass and graphic art appear, change, and shift in an endless variety of patterns. This live action documentary technique creates a fantasy world of colour, light and form with a slight thread of story involving a child.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Praha Loutkovy Film and Short Film Studio

results.title: Glimpses of Western India
results.creator_credit: S.N.S Sastry, Ezra Mir and Films Division, Government of India
results.brief_description: Bombay and the sights to see nearby; Malabar Hill and the hanging gardens; the eight century Hindu cave temples of Elephanta island; Nasik and its pilgrims; Aurangabad the Mogul City; tombs of mediaeval kings; the Ellora caves; cave frescoes at Aguiba; the landscape and the life of the people.

results.title: Glimpses of Gandhiji = Glimpses of Ghandhi
results.brief_description: A survey of the life or Mahatma Ghandhiji. Recalls his childhood; student life in England; the launching of the Satyagraha Campaign in South Africa and subsequently in India; and his martyrdom in January 1948 when a whole nation was plunged into mourning.

results.title: Glimpses of enchanting Japan
results.brief_description: A colourful variety of aspects of the land and nature of Japan. Beginning with the new year the film introduces the Grand Shrines of Ise, most honoured of the national shrines; the charming doll festival; the dramatic “water drawing’ rites of Nara are illuminated by torch light; the Mibu pantomime of Kyoto and the Dontaku festival of Hakata. Interspersed are shots of ancient temples and shrines contrasting with ultra-modern structures based on traditional architecture.

results.title: A Glimpse at a thousand points
results.brief_description: A discussion of the discoveries of the light deflector. Cathodes ray tube and photocell lead to a simple explanation of how television works and modern developments in television technology.
